author.description: Today I learned an interesting historical fact. Just have a look at the calendar for the month of September 1752. author.name: sanjeev
author.title: New Date and Time API in Java8
author.description: The existing Java date and time classes are poor, mutable, and have unpredictable performance. There has been a long-standing desire for a better date and time API based on the Joda-Time project. The good news is that the ... - <a href="http://blog.sanjeevonline.com/articles/2013-05-27-New-Date-Time-API/">Lire la suite</a>

author.title: High school reunion
author.description: It was pleasure meeting childhood friends from school after 18 years. author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Evolution of Java
author.description: I thought it would be useful for java developers to understand how Java has evolved since its inception so that they are aware of what all capabilities they have access to when working with a particular version of Java. - <a href="http://blog.sanjeevonline.com/articles/2011-10-23-Evolution-Of-Java/">Lire la suite</a>

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Choosing the right collection
author.description: Here is a quick guide for selecting the proper implementation of a Set, List, or Map in your application. The best general purpose or 'primary' implementations are likely ArrayList, LinkedHashMap, and LinkedHashSet. Their overall performance is better, and you should use them unless you need a special feature provided by another implementation ... - <a href="http://blog.sanjeevonline.com/articles/2012-01-05-Choosing-The-Right-Collections/">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: Here is a quick guide for selecting the proper implementation of a Set, List, or Map in your application. The best general purpose or 'primary' implementations are likely ArrayList, LinkedHashMap, and LinkedHashSet. Their overall performance is better, and you should use them unless you need a special feature provided by another implementation ...

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Change default author name for JavaDocs in Eclipse
author.description: The auto generated Java docs at the class level picks the user name from the system user. This could result in weird author names in your code files as in an organization usernames are usually as per organizational naming conventions - <a href="http://blog.sanjeevonline.com/articles/2011-08-03-Changing-Default-Author-Eclipse/">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: The auto generated Java docs at the class level picks the user name from the system user. This could result in weird author names in your code files as in an organization usernames are usually as per organizational naming conventions

author.name: sanjeev
author.title: Remote debugging in Eclipse
author.description: To debug your application on JBOSS server you would need to enable the debugging on your JBOSS application server - <a href="http://blog.sanjeevonline.com/articles/2011-07-08-Remote-Debugging-Jboss/">Lire la suite</a>
author.content: To debug your application on JBOSS server you would need to enable the debugging on your JBOSS application server
